availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin L. McGlasson (Kenton County, Kentucky merchant)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah McGlasson. Father of Frank McGlasson, Benjamin L. McGlasson, Mary Ann McGlasson, and Laura McGlasson. Farmer in Gallatin County in 1850. Postmaster at Slusher, Boone County, from July 27, 1853, to April 8, 1854. Merchant in Covington, Kenton County, in 1860. Employed Mary Nudd in 1860. Dry goods merchant with J. H. McGlasson in Covington in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Gallatin County, p. 290A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington 5th Ward, p. 761.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Independence, p. 277A.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971. Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Boone County, Kentucky, Volume 14, p. 206 of microfilm.
